page.title: 01SOUTH-EAST MAIDSTONE
page.content: The area to the south-east of Maidstone is an interesting mix of suburban housing, light industrial development, and agricultural land. The housing varies between bungalows around Otham Hole, council housing at Parkwood and private dwellings, old and new, along the Loose Road. The light industry is centered on the Parkwood Trading Estate. Running through the middle of the area, from east to west, is the River Loose, a modest tributary of the Medway. The millponds near Loose are evidence of the corn, fulling, and paper mills that once worked in this picturesque valley, and there are many signs of old stone quarries. The surrounding countryside, on the Greensand ridge, is mostly given over to fruit farming, though there are other crops and some sheep.
